intro: Ephedra patagonica, commonly known as Patagonian ephedra, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ephedraceae and is characterized by its jointed stems and small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces greenish-yellow flowers and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Ephedra patagonica is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of the local flora in Patagonia. Its structure and growth habits reflect its evolutionary adaptation to extreme climatic conditions.
